facts: The first computer programmer was Ada Lovelace in the 1800s.
The first electronic general-purpose computer, ENIAC, weighed over 27 tons.
The first computer virus, called 'Creeper', appeared in the 1970s.
The term 'bug' for software issues comes from a real moth found in a computer.
The world's first website is still online at info.cern.ch.
